intro: Barnettia pagetii, commonly known as the Paget's barnettia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Barnettia pagetii is considered a rare and endangered species.
